value.title: Power BI slicers vs the filter pane (2021)
value.excerpt: What's the difference between Power BI slicers and the Filter pane? The filter panel can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  Slicer Panel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xy9nmSQeUWg  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: EVERYTHING you wanted to know about Power BI tooltips
value.excerpt: Power BI tooltips can add a lot of context to a visual. Patrick shows you everything you need to know about tooltips in Power BI!  Prathy's (@pkamasani) Blog about Visual Header Tooltips: https://prathy.com/2019/07/power-bi-visual-header-tooltip/  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/tooltipsample  üì¢

value.title: Power BI date table: create using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to create a Power BI date table using DAX. The end result uses a combination of the GENERATE(), ROW() and CALENDARAUTO() DAX functions to create a calculated table resulting in a Power BI date table.  Using GENERATE and ROW instead of ADDCOLUMNS in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-generate-and-row-instead-of-addcolumns-in-dax/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gyvhM5eiT0U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: POWERAPPS and POWER BI can do what?!? It's bananas!
value.excerpt: Patrick takes a look at how you can integrate PowerApps with Power BI to get a bananas experience. Updating the PowerApp does something special with the Power BI report.  Create a PowerApp: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/  PowerApps custom visual: https://docs.microsoft.com/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/powerapps-custom-visual

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: 20 tricks to finally master the Matrix visualization in Power BI!!
value.excerpt: The matrix visualization has over 100 configuration options, and some of the most basic functionality, like hiding subtotals is not so easy to discover.  In today's video, I will show you 20 things you can do on the matrix that will take that visualization to the next level.  Did I miss any? Let me know

value.title: How to filter a table to show only most recent date by group in Power Query
value.excerpt: It is a best practice to load in Power Bi only the data that you need. In today's video, I will show you how you can filter a table by the last date available. value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Dynamic Power BI reports using Parameters
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can use a parameter, within a Power BI report, to dynamically change the data in a report. This uses M Functions within Power Query and a second source that has the key values to pull. Then using a gateway to enable refresh.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/
